page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY CONTD
page.content: mainly as an ammunition store and took 3 1/2 years to build though it was never completed. They also built batteries, magazines and concrete bunkers at vantage points around the cliffs. The Pepper Pot on the north side of Fermain Bay is the remains of the look-out for the Clarence Battery which was built for the German guns. {BUILDINGS AND MONUMENTS }Sausmarez (summaray) Manor on Sausmarez Road has been the home of the de Sausmarez family for the greater part of 7 centuries, since the first part of the house was built in the 13th century. It is built of granite and is the only major unrestored manor house on the island. 4 sections have been added to the original building, in the 16th century, the early 18th century, the Regency and late 19th century. Doyle Monument at Jerbourg (Jerberg)
